title.children: In his youth, Sahr found himself continually in trouble. Now he's helping others break that cycle

items.synopsis: US President Joe Biden says he thinks Hamas’ initial attack on Israel was tied in part to efforts to normalise relations between Israel and Saudi Arabia.

title.children: Biden says Hamas attacked Israel in part to halt normalisation with Saudi Arabia

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Uri Raanan says he learned of his daughter and ex-wife's release from photos on television. "I did not get a phone call," he said. "First of all, I got a lot of pictures from the TV in Israel. They showed the release of them. "And later I got a phone call from the IDF they told me they were going to meet them and that they were going to call me." He added he had spoken to his daughter since the release. "I have been glued to the TV for two weeks, hoping for good news. Finally it came through."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Father learned of hostage release 'from the TV'

children.content: Uri Raanan says he learned of his daughter and ex-wife's release from photos on television.
"I did not get a phone call," he said.
"First of all, I got a lot of pictures from the TV in Israel. They showed the release of them.
"And later I got a phone call from the IDF they told me they were going to meet them and that they were going to call me."
He added he had spoken to his daughter since the release.
"I have been glued to the TV for two weeks, hoping for good news. Finally it came through."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: US President Joe Biden has said he thought Hamas was motivated to attack Israel in part by a desire to stop that country from normalising relations with Saudi Arabia. "One of the reasons Hamas moved on Israel … they knew that I was about to sit down with the Saudis," Biden said at a fundraising event. The US president indicated that he thinks Hamas militants launched a deadly assault on October 7 because, "Guess what? The Saudis wanted to recognise Israel" and were near being able to formally do so. Hamas is yet to respond to Biden's comments. Jerusalem and Riyadh had been steadily inching closer to normalisation, with Biden working to help bring the two countries together, announcing plans in September at the Group of 20 summit in India to partner on a shipping corridor. The Saudis had been insisting on protections and expanded rights for Palestinian interests as part of any broader agreement with Israel. An agreement would have been a feat of diplomacy that could have enabled broader recognition of Israel by other Arab and Muslim-majority nations that have largely opposed Israel since its creation 75 years ago in territory where Palestinians have long resided. But talks were interrupted after Hamas militants stormed from the blockaded Gaza Strip where Palestinians live into nearby Israeli towns two weeks ago. AP
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Biden says Hamas attacked Israel in part to stop historic agreement with Saudi Arabia

props.alt: Joe Biden walks up the steps of Air Force One

children.content: US President Joe Biden has said he thought Hamas was motivated to attack Israel in part by a desire to stop that country from normalising relations with Saudi Arabia.
"One of the reasons Hamas moved on Israel … they knew that I was about to sit down with the Saudis," Biden said at a fundraising event.

The US president indicated that he thinks Hamas militants launched a deadly assault on October 7 because, "Guess what? The Saudis wanted to recognise Israel" and were near being able to formally do so.
Hamas is yet to respond to Biden's comments.

Jerusalem and Riyadh had been steadily inching closer to normalisation, with Biden working to help bring the two countries together, announcing plans in September at the Group of 20 summit in India to partner on a shipping corridor.

The Saudis had been insisting on protections and expanded rights for Palestinian interests as part of any broader agreement with Israel. An agreement would have been a feat of diplomacy that could have enabled broader recognition of Israel by other Arab and Muslim-majority nations that have largely opposed Israel since its creation 75 years ago in territory where Palestinians have long resided.
But talks were interrupted after Hamas militants stormed from the blockaded Gaza Strip where Palestinians live into nearby Israeli towns two weeks ago.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Hamas has released video of American mother and daughter Judith and Natalia Raanan being handed over to Red Cross officials. The footage was released by Hamas's armed wing, al-Qassam Brigade.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Video released of American hostages being freed

children.content: Hamas has released video of American mother and daughter Judith and Natalia Raanan being handed over to Red Cross officials.
The footage was released by Hamas's armed wing, al-Qassam Brigade.
